   19: %%
   20: 
   21: -module(ssl_alert_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -behaviour(ct_suite).
   24: 
   25: -include("ssl_test_lib.hrl").
   26: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   27: -include_lib("public_key/include/public_key.hrl").
   28: 
   29: -include_lib("ssl/src/ssl_alert.hrl").
   30: 
   31: %% Common test
   32: -export([all/0,
   33:          init_per_suite/1,
   34:          end_per_suite/1,
   35:          init_per_testcase/2,
   36:          end_per_testcase/2
   37:         ]).
   38: 
   39: %% Test cases
   40: -export([alerts/0,
   41:          alerts/1,
   42:          alert_details/0,
   43:          alert_details/1,
   44:          alert_details_not_too_big/0,
   45:          alert_details_not_too_big/1,
   46:          bad_connect_response/1
   47:         ]).
   48: 
   49: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   50: %% Common Test interface functions -----------------------------------
   51: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   52: all() -> 
   53:     [
   54:      alerts,
   55:      alert_details,
   56:      alert_details_not_too_big,
   57:      bad_connect_response
   58:     ].
   59: 
   60: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
   61:     catch crypto:stop(),
   62:     try crypto:start() of
   63: 	ok ->
   64:             ssl_test_lib:clean_start(),
   65:             Config0
   66:     catch _:_ ->
   67: 	    {skip, "Crypto did not start"}
   68:     end.
   69: 
   70: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   71:     ssl:stop(),
   72:     application:stop(crypto).
   73: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
   74:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 5}),
   75:     Config.
   76: 
   77: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->     
   78:     Config.
   79: 
   80: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   81: %% Test Cases --------------------------------------------------------
   82: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   83: alerts() ->
   84:     [{doc, "Test ssl_alert formatting code"}].
   85: alerts(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   86:     Descriptions = [?CLOSE_NOTIFY, ?UNEXPECTED_MESSAGE, ?BAD_RECORD_MAC,
   87: 		    ?DECRYPTION_FAILED_RESERVED, ?RECORD_OVERFLOW, ?DECOMPRESSION_FAILURE,
   88: 		    ?HANDSHAKE_FAILURE, ?BAD_CERTIFICATE, ?UNSUPPORTED_CERTIFICATE,
   89: 		    ?CERTIFICATE_REVOKED,?CERTIFICATE_EXPIRED, ?CERTIFICATE_UNKNOWN,
   90: 		    ?ILLEGAL_PARAMETER, ?UNKNOWN_CA, ?ACCESS_DENIED, ?DECODE_ERROR,
   91: 		    ?DECRYPT_ERROR, ?EXPORT_RESTRICTION, ?PROTOCOL_VERSION, 
   92: 		    ?INSUFFICIENT_SECURITY, ?INTERNAL_ERROR, ?USER_CANCELED,
   93: 		    ?NO_RENEGOTIATION, ?UNSUPPORTED_EXTENSION, ?CERTIFICATE_UNOBTAINABLE,
   94: 		    ?UNRECOGNIZED_NAME, ?BAD_CERTIFICATE_STATUS_RESPONSE,
   95: 		    ?BAD_CERTIFICATE_HASH_VALUE, ?UNKNOWN_PSK_IDENTITY, 
   96: 		    255 %% Unsupported/unknown alert will result in a description too
   97: 		   ],
   98:     Alerts = [?ALERT_REC(?WARNING, ?CLOSE_NOTIFY) | 
   99: 	      [?ALERT_REC(?FATAL, Desc) || Desc <- Descriptions]],
  100:     lists:foreach(fun(Alert) ->
  101:                           try 
  102:                               ssl_alert:reason_code(Alert, server, "TLS", cipher),
  103:                               ssl_alert:reason_code(Alert, client, "TLS", hello)
  104:                           catch
  105: 			    C:E:T ->
  106:                                   ct:fail({unexpected, {C, E, T}})
  107: 			end 
  108: 		  end, Alerts).
  109: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  110: alert_details() ->
  111:     [{doc, "Test that ssl_alert:alert_txt/1 result contains extendend error description"}].
  112: alert_details(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  113:     Unique = make_ref(),
  114:     UniqueStr = lists:flatten(io_lib:format("~w", [Unique])),
  115:     Alert = ?ALERT_REC(?WARNING, ?INTERNAL_ERROR, Unique),
  116:     {tls_alert, {_, Txt}} = ssl_alert:reason_code(Alert#alert{role=server}, server, "TLS", cipher),
  117:     case string:str(Txt, UniqueStr) of
  118:         0 ->
  119:             ct:fail(error_details_missing);
  120:         _ ->
  121:             ok
  122:     end.
  123: 
  124: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  125: alert_details_not_too_big() ->
  126:     [{doc, "Test that ssl_alert:alert_txt/1 limits printed depth of extended error description"}].
  127: alert_details_not_too_big(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  128:     Reason = ssl:cipher_suites(all, 'tlsv1.2'),
  129:     ReasonText = lists:flatten(io_lib:format("~p", [Reason])),
  130:     Alert = ?ALERT_REC(?FATAL, ?HANDSHAKE_FAILURE, Reason),
  131:     PrefixLen = 
  132:         length("TLS server: In state cipher at ssl_handshake.erl:1710 generated SERVER ALERT: Fatal - Handshake Failure"),
  133:     {tls_alert, {_, Txt}} = ssl_alert:reason_code(Alert#alert{role=server, where = #{file => "ssl_handshake.erl", 
  134:                                                                                      line => 1710}}, server, "TLS", cipher),
  135:     case byte_size(term_to_binary(Txt)) < (byte_size(term_to_binary(ReasonText)) - PrefixLen) of
  136:         true ->
  137:             ?CT_PAL("~s", [Txt]);
  138:         false ->
  139:             ct:fail(ssl_alert_text_too_big)
  140:     end.
  141: 
  142: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  143: bad_connect_response(_Config) ->
  144:     Me = self(),
  145:     spawn_link(fun() -> echo_server_init(Me) end),
  146:     Port = receive {port, P} -> P end,
  147:     application:ensure_all_started(ssl),
  148:     ok = check_response(catch ssl:connect("localhost", Port, [{versions, ['tlsv1.3']},
  149:                                                               {verify, verify_none}])),
  150:     ok = check_response(catch ssl:connect("localhost", Port, [{versions, ['tlsv1.2']},
  151:                                                               {verify, verify_none}])),
  152:     ok = check_response(catch ssl:connect("localhost", Port, [{versions, ['tlsv1.1']},
  153:                                                               {verify, verify_none}])),
  154:     ok.
  155: 
  156: check_response({error, {tls_alert, {unexpected_message, _}}}) ->
  157:     ok;
  158: check_response({error, {options, {insufficient_crypto_support,_}}}) ->
  159:     ok;
  160: check_response(What) ->
  161:     ?CT_PAL("RES: ~p~n", [What]),
  162:     What.
  163: 
  164: echo_server_init(Tester) ->
  165:     {ok, Listen} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{active, true}, binary]),
  166:     {ok, Port} = inet:port(Listen),
  167:     Tester ! {port, Port},
  168:     {ok, Socket} = gen_tcp:accept(Listen),
  169:     echo_server(Socket, Listen).
  170: 
  171: echo_server(Socket, Listen) ->
  172:     receive
  173:         {tcp, Socket, Bin} when is_binary(Bin) ->
  174:             gen_tcp:send(Socket, Bin),
  175:             echo_server(Socket, Listen);
  176:         {tcp_closed, Socket} ->
  177:             {ok, New} = gen_tcp:accept(Listen),
  178:             echo_server(New, Listen);
  179:         Msg ->
  180:             ?CT_PAL("Server: ~p~n", [Msg]),
  181:             echo_server(Socket, Listen)
  182:     end.
  183: 
  184:
